intro: Tribulus macropodus, commonly known as the large-fruited cat's claw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated, red berries. Tribulus macropodus is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
